class py_sim.tools.sim_types.EllipseParameters(a: float = 0.0, b: float = 0.0, center: ~py_sim.tools.sim_types.TwoDimArray = <py_sim.tools.sim_types.TwoDimArray object>, alpha: float = 0.0)¶

Bases: object

Defines the parameters necessary for defining an ellipse

a: Major axis radius b: Minor axis radius center: Center point of the ellipse alpha: orientation from x-axis of ellipse

property alpha: float¶

Return the alpha component

property c_a: float¶

Returns the cosine of alpha

property s_a: float¶

Returns the sine of alpha

class py_sim.tools.sim_types.StateSpace(x_lim: tuple[float, float], y_lim: tuple[float, float])¶

Bases: object

Defines the rectangular limits of a state space

contains(state: TwoDimArray) → bool¶

Evaluates if the state is in the state space. Returns true if it is

Inputs:

state: State to be evaluated

Outputs:

True if the state is in the state space, false otherwise

furthest_point(x: TwoDimArray) → TwoDimArray¶

Returns the furthest point in the state space furthest from x

Inputs:

x: An point to evaluate

Outputs:

The furthest point from x

class py_sim.tools.sim_types.UnicycleState(x: float = 0.0, y: float = 0.0, psi: float = 0.0)¶

Bases: object

Provides a representation of the vehicle whose state consists of an (x,y) position and an orientation (psi)

IND_X: int = 0¶
IND_Y: int = 1¶
n_states: int = 3¶
property position: ndarray[Any, dtype[Any]]¶

Return the 2D position vector

property psi: float¶

Return the orientation value

property x: float¶

Return the x-position value

property y: float¶

Return the y-position value
